title: Hello everyone
content:
Hello all,

I'm Szymon Bartus (I use my real name on forums), this is my first post here, it's great to find some really cool websites about Commander Keen series. This was one of my first PC games, I was about 5 or 6 years old when I first saw C.K.
My favourite episodes were always 4, 5 and 6. Now I'm using DOSbox and Windows XP to play Keen. I'm from Poland, so forgive me my mistakes, if you see something wrong, you can correct me.
Oh - and you have some extremely cool emoticons! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
Hi dude, and welcome. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I was very young too when I first played Keen, and in fact, it was the very first thing I played. How old are you now, if I may ask? And yeah, these emoticons are cool! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
I'm pretty sure we're used to foreign spelling mistakes, since some of the English-speaking people here barely have their own language mastered.

These emoticons are just too damn adorable, aren't they?
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] -----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
Yeah... if I remember correctly we have (Or at least HAD) quite a few non-english speakers on the forums. Sooo don't feel bad for any spelling mistakes or whatnot. I mean... English is my native language and I can't even pronouce it correctly mainly due to the heavy German influence on the local dialect around in this area. (I've been told that I have German word order in my sentences sometimes.)

Anyhoo- Nice to see a new member! Hope you stick around and contribute (post wise) much.

And Q90... that avatar is SCARY! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] -----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
Welcome! This is a very linguistically diverse place.
I hope you have fun!

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
Greetings, and welcome. It's always wonderful, when new people discover this place. Hope you enjoy it!

I was about 7 when I first played Keen (and I'm fairly certain it was the very first DOS game I ever played). That moment is forever etched in my memory.

title: Welcome!
content: Welcome aboard! Always cool to see more people using their real names on forums.

title: Re: Welcome!
content:
I agree, real names are always more inventive than avatars. Welcome welcome welcome, please don't run away!Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
[quote]How old are you now, if I may ask?[/quote]
I'm 16 now, so it's more than 10 years (with huge, huge breaks of course) of playing Commander Keen!

Using real name is actually very good for me. I don't have virtually any nicks. And it's also nicer to talk sometimes to the real named user than nick. There are even more reasons but this is topic for another thread [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Thanks for replies!

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
I agree. Your real name would probably be the best. Unfortunately, those of us with terrible names don't quite have that luxury.

For some reason or another most people can't say "Stoltzfus" correctly. So instead of using my real German name I used the next best thing.

I used a MADE UP German name. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] -----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
Witam!

Ja tez jestem z Polski, z Warszawy. Mieszkam w Australii od ~17 lat, ale dobrze jest czasami po Polsku porozmawiac. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ------------------
[url=http://www.szevvy.net]www.szevvy.net[/url], for all your Wombat needs. You know you want to.
A member of the LevelLord fan club.

title: Re: Hello everyone
content:
Whoa hey, I didn't welcome you yet?

Well, uh, welcome to PCKF! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.
